title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act may be cited as the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" and includes expanded tax benefits for adoption made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" includes permanent expansions for adoption tax benefits enacted in 2001 and 2010. The dollar limitation for the adoption credit was increased to $13,170, and a $10,000 credit for adopting a child with special needs was reinstated. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increased the adoption credit to $13,170 and reinstated a $10,000 credit for adopting a child with special needs. Subsection (h) of section 23 of the tax code was amended for inflation adjustments. Beginning after December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in certain subsections will be increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, income limitations will be adjusted for taxable years starting after December 31, 2002. The dollar amounts in subsection (b)(2)(A)(i) will be increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, the dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs will be increased from $10,000 to $13,170. The dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs is amended from $10,000 to $13,170, with adjustments made for inflation. The dollar limitations for adoption assistance programs are adjusted for inflation, with subsection (f) of section 137 of the tax code amended accordingly. Starting from December 31, 2010, dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be increased based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. The dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A) for taxable years after December 31, 2002, will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment. Any amount not a multiple of $10 will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A) for taxable years after December 31, 2002, will be increased by a cost-of-living adjustment and rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, the credit is made refundable and moved to a different section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 includes conforming amendments to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as striking references to specific sections like 23 and 25D and inserting new references. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including striking specific references like "23" and "25D" and inserting new references. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including updating references by striking "23" and inserting "36C" in multiple sections. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include updating references by striking "23" and inserting "36C" in multiple sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting a new item after section 36B. The amendments made by this subsection relate to adoption expenses and are effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
